Electronic Hardware & Component parts and accessories
full_summary:
# Electronic Products Tender Notice

## Announcement

Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is inviting pre-qualified suppliers to submit bids for the procurement of electronic products under the E60HN-16ELEC Supply Arrangement (SA).

## Notice Details

| Field | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Solicitation Number | NRCan-5000077195 |
| Reference Number | cb-436-63256226 |
| Amendment Number | 4 |
| Publication Date | January 19, 2024 |
| Tender Closing Date | February 2, 2024, at 13:00 EST |
| Expected Contract Start Date | February 9, 2024 |
| Expected Contract End Date | March 31, 2024 |
| Tender Status | Expired |
| Trade Agreements | Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) |

## Requested Goods or Services

DC power supplies, as described in the Notice of Proposed Procurement.

## Delivery and Requirements

* Delivery to: Varennes, QC
* Delivery required by: March 29, 2024

## Selection Criteria

Tenders will be evaluated based on lowest price.

## Contact Information

* Marie-Josée Michaud
* Phone: 418 563-6916
* Email: [marie-josee.michaud@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca](mailto:marie-josee.michaud@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca)

## Tender Documents

The tender notice and documents can be downloaded from the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/29902/npp---nrcan-5000077195.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/29902/npp---nrcan-5000077195.pdf)

## Closing Notes

This notice is a part of the Supply Arrangement and is only open to pre-qualified suppliers. Suppliers who do not hold a Supply Arrangement in series E60HN-16ELEC with PSPC are not eligible to submit a bid. 

Note: 
- I reformatted it as a nice markdown table for better readability.
- I change "expired" to mention the more formal requirement of a tender status, to make the text less " Casual".
- I considered blank fields as redundant information.
- I shortened any lengthy language in the original text, and kept a formal but
